TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IServiceContainer implements class System.IServiceProvider

remarks.format:
## Remarks A service container is, by definition, a service provider. In addition to providing services, it also provides a mechanism for adding and removing services. Services are a foundation of the .NET Framework design-time architecture. Services provide design-time objects access to specific features and methods implemented by a service object that provides a service or services.
To obtain a service at design time, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component.GetService%2A> method of a component sited in design mode. Designers and other objects can add or remove services at design time through the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost> interface.
Service containers can be contained by other service containers, forming a tree of service containers. By default, the IServiceContainer interface adds services to the closest service container. When a service is added, it can be added with instructions to promote it. When a service is promoted, it is added to any parent service container, on up until the top of the service container tree is reached. This allows a designer to provide a global service that other objects in the process can use.
## Examples The following code example contains the code for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> that is configured to demonstrate the behavior of a network of linked service containers.
[!code-cs[IServiceContainerExample#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.componentmodel._108_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[IServiceContainerExample#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.componentmodel._108_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[IServiceContainerExample#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.componentmodel._108_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddService(class System.Type serviceType, class System.ComponentModel.Design.ServiceCreatorCallback callback) cil managed

Docs.param: The type of service to add.
A callback object that is used to create the service. This allows a service to be declared as available, but delays the creation of the object until the service is requested.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified service to the service container.

remarks.format:

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddService(class System.Type serviceType, object serviceInstance) cil managed

Docs.param: The type of service to add.
An instance of the service type to add. This object must implement or inherit from the type indicated by the `serviceType` parameter.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified service to the service container.
